Tweet: My district canceled school for tomorrow because were currently getting hit by snowmageddon. Im glad because I like to catch up on my sleep (I get none), but this screws up my lesson plans so much, lol...
Spent the afternoon at a political event. Some of my APUSGOV students were there, which was very cool. I love that theyre being active in the community.
@NicholasFerroni Reese Witherspoon because when people ask how I teach government in 2018, I quote this a lot:pic.twitter.com/RFW5PlrpNZ

Ill have more about this in my daily blog entry, but let me just say... APUSGOV Court Madness debates... Bribes in the form of baked goods were offered... The Constitution was dramatically flourished... I love this class.

Had lunch with two of my buddies who teach other subjects in other districts. Ended up discussing the state of affairs. Its a comfort to know were all kind of in the same place in terms of our thinking- and in terms of what were still trying to figure out.

@FLES_Teacher I mostly can, but it took a few years to get there. Disclaimers: I do have a good amount of prep time in my schedule and I read stupid fast.  But my other trick is carrying my grading on a clipboard and doing it while students work independently.
Spoke too soon. Supe just emailed the whole staff. I wrote back to ask what the district's response will be to student protesters because I want that to be very clear. We'll see what he says.
So... I'm on vacation this week, but I still check my school email. I'm kind of surprised none of the admins have sent anything re: parkland, protests, etc... Monday might be very interesting.
@ElemEdTruths Thankfully no. Im actually on vacation this week. Its giving me lots of time to think about what to say about everything when I face my students next...
@ElemEdTruths Thanks for the concern! Im fine. The boy apologized for what hed done, grew up, and became a responsible adult. And Im glad he got the chance to change, you know?
I will never carry a gun. I think it's ridiculous anyone thinks I should. Come back to me with real solutions, or get out of the way while the rest of us work. 4/4

He turned to go charging at the other boy. I stepped in front of him. And I got hit. And shoved out of the way. What actually happened next is one on my colleagues tackled this boy. Imagine what would have happened if I'd had a gun, and this boy had grabbed it. Jesus. 3/?

I pushed them apart, and started walking one boy away. Another teacher was walking the other boy in the opposite direction. Other boy said something. I don't remember what it was, but I do remember that the boy I was walking with saw red. His whole face changed. 2/?

Story time, kids. I broke up a fight in front of my classroom once. Two boys who were both bigger than me by half a foot and at least thirty pounds were going at it, and I jumped between them (you can debate how smart that was later). 1/?
The fact that my cousin and I are teachers is straining the family discourse this week. And you know what? Good. Everyone needs to think harder about what they believe and why.
